data.title: Oscar-Nominated Actress Rachel McAdams Explains Why She Didn't Do ‘Mean Girls’ Reunion Commercial
data.meta_description: Oscar-nominated actress Rachel McAdam's memorable role in her career so far was playing the Queen of the Plastics Regina George in 2004 teen comedy "Mean Girls." A film based on a non-fiction book titled Queen Bees and Wannabes. Walmart commercial created
data.text:
Oscar-nominated actress Rachel McAdam's memorable role in her career so far was playing the Queen of the Plastics Regina George in 2004 teen comedy "Mean Girls." A film based on a non-fiction book titled Queen Bees and Wannabes. Walmart commercial ​ created a mini reunion of Mean Girls cast members. It aired early November as it featured Lindsay Lohan, Amanda Seyfried, and Lacey Chabert. Absence in the commercial was Rachel McAdams. Here is her statement on why she wasn't able to participate in the commercial:

Similar Topic: A Mini- Mean Girls Reunion For A Walmart Commercial

"To be honest, I wasn't particularly enthusiastic about doing a commercial. I have always been interested in movies, not commercials, so it didn't appeal to me. Additionally, I was not aware that everyone else was participating. Of course, I would always love to be part of a 'Mean Girls' reunion and spend time with my Plastics, but I learned about it later on."

Meanwhile, Paramount Pictures will be releasing a musical adaptation of Mean Girls in January 2024, with writer Tina Fey returning. McAdams will not be appear in the adaptation, although Tina Fey and Tim Meadows will be reprising their roles. However, there's a chance Regina might make a cameo. Here is McAdams' statement about that:

"Tina and I explored a few ideas, but ultimately it was challenging to make everything work out. I was open to whatever she wanted to do. I believe the direction they took will be fantastic, and I am eager to see it."

Source: Variety
